intro: Gurania cissoides, commonly known as the creeping gurania, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its trailing growth habit and produces small, yellowish-white flowers. Its leaves are ovate to lanceolate in shape and often have a hairy texture. Gurania cissoides is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and rocky crevices.
